reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel has a great location in East Berlin near all the major sites. We didn't eat in the Hotel as there are some great restaurants close by ( including a great place to have breafast at a fraction of the price charged in the hotel called Mohring).
reviews.title: Easter in Berlin

reviews.text: There is little to add to the other reviews, except to confirm the GREAT location of this Hilton Hotel. All the museum are within short walking distance, public transportation in front of the hotel (also the busstop for the direct bus to airport Tegel is nearby), nice shops around the corner and good restaurants nearby. The only time I used the public transportation, was to go to West Berlin (Kudamm). But I prefer East Berlin and the Hilton is perfectly situated. I would definately return here!
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.text: Look around for a good price. I paid only EUR 100 per room per night, including breakfast! I booked this through an travel agent. I also approached the Hilton directly, but they couldn't offer my this price.
reviews.title: Great Hotel
Well Pleased Tourists
reviews.text: I stayed at his Hotel for a week during February. The year before I had stayed at the Marriott – which I consider the best hotel ever - so, first thing I needed while checking in at the Hilton was to acknowledge I could be disappointed because I wouldn’t be stayed at the Marriott. Nevertheless, the Hilton revealed itself as a great experience and a great hotel. I stayed at the business floor. The rooms are big, clean and beautiful. Bathroom was extremely clean and functional, although not very big. Breakfast was amazing. Staff was helpful and always had a smile. Lobby is huge and there was live music at the bar. Berlin is an amazing city and I would return to this Hotel without blinking my eyes.

reviews.title: Excellent Hotel
reviews.text: We have just returned from a four day trip to Berlin staying at the Hilton Berlin. The hotel is in a very good location for both shopping and exploring the city. The staff are friendly and helpful and the rooms are spotless. We ate at two of the restaurants in the hotel - the Italian and the Polynesian and enjoyed the food very much. The chocolate shop beside the hotel serves excellent hot chocolate and puddings and is well worth a visit. We all agreed that we would return to Berlin and stay at the Hilton Berlin.

Perfect location- close to sights, restaurants (Borchardt and many others) and shopping (Galeries Lafayette, H&M etc). Subway station "Mitte" right outside the hotel. Check-in was perfect: although I arrived early and had not told them (naughty me)- I got a beautiful room which was both quiet (facing the green courtyard) and had a view of the top of the German dome. Toiletries are La Source (Crabtree and Evelyn), great bathrobe and towels. Plenty of places nearby for a decent breakfast, e.g. Quchnia, Shan Rahimkhan or Einstein Kaffee-all have free wifi- the wifi in the hotel is expensive (22 Euros per day for a good connection). Spa area is ok but also costs extra- only small pool is free for hotel guests. Don’t use the manicure in the hotel- it is terrible and expensive. Executive Lounge on the ground floor is very cool and has Internet access.
reviews.title: Great location, well-trained staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just spent 5 nights at the Hilton Hotel. We were on the Executive Level, and had access to the Executive Lounge. The facility was beautiful and well maintained. The location was excellent. The staff at the Executive Lounge were extremely helpful in making dinner reservations and giving recommendations. Breakfast in the lounge was more than sufficient, and included eggs, bacon and sausages. Evening happy hour was comfortable.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay, beautiful property, very helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is right across from the Stadtmitte U-Bahn station, which made it very easy for us to go to other parts of the city.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel for Tourism or Business

reviews.text: One good thing to know - there are two major supermarkets within two blocks of the hotel. You can buy bottled water and soft drinks for your room at a fraction of the cost of the hotels mini-bar.
reviews.title: Refurbished Hotel in Excellent Central Location

reviews.text: We stayed here for a 4 night city break in Berlin - a great city with a friendly atmosphere and much to offer. We were lucky enough to have a room with access to the executive lounge in this excellent hotel. Moderately sized rooms are nicely furnished, very comfortable, and some have great views across the adjacent Gendarmenmarkt. The rooms are maintained spotlessly clean and serviced twice per day. We made extensive use of the comfortable executive lounge with its complimentary snacks, tea, coffee, and drinks. The hotel also serves an excellent breakfast buffet in its main restaurant. We encountered no problems at all during our stay and we found all of the staff courteous, pleasant, and eager to help with whatever we needed. Overall, we had the impression of a very efficiently run hotel which has set high standards for itself. Actually, we would rate this as one of our best hotel stays.
reviews.title: Great business hotel for tourists

reviews.text: We were in Berlin to celebrate a friend's birthday and to visit the Christmas Markets.
reviews.title: Great Location - but not the usual Hilton Standard
Great place to stay in Berlin !
reviews.text: In terms of Berlin and the proximity to all the great sites/areas - this hotel is in a very good position. Berlin is one of my favourite cities - and you cannot go wrong in this location.
The breakfast was also ok; lobby bar is fair; but the Trader Vics bar lounge is awful, kitsch and tacky.
reviews.title: What a great hotel....Loved it.

reviews.text: The reception is vast and anonymous. Check in efficient but inflexible re: early arrivals. We had to walk around town and come back after 4pm. Not great when you want to have a quick shower and freshen up.
reviews.title: Good service, very average rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are very basic. Very few have a decent view i.e. over the beautiful square to the front. Our first two rooms were so small and so musty, we complained. We got upgraded, but to our horror, the bathroom in the suite had not been cleaned satisfactorily. In fact, it was pretty dirty.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked a duplex suite oon 6th floor for 5 nights. The room was rather tired and the furniture was stained.
reviews.title: OK Stay at the Hilton
Good Hotel, Exceptional Staff, Best Location
reviews.text: Staff in the Executive Lounge were very good but for the price paid (EUR355 per night), should have stayed at the Ritz Carlton.

What can I add to what has already been said ? Well the hotel is very good maybe in need of a smarten up and rooms even on executive floor are on the small side but of a high standard. However that's a small price to pay for the perfect location and exceptional service and staff, especially on the executive floor. The pool and sauna area (extra charge) were superior. Would defintely recommend it and will stay there when back in Berlin.
reviews.title: Great Location for a New Year trip.

reviews.text: We checked in on Dec 29th and although given a smallish room facing the inner courtyard - it was a comfortable and well appointed room. I booked directly with Hilton on the internet and got a good advance rate. This hotel has the best possible location for the Christmas Gendarmenmarkt, Friedrichstrasse shopping and not that far from the party at the Brandenburg Gate on New Year's Eve. My mind still divides Berlin into East and West and I found this MITTE part of the former East has turned into the most interesting and lively part of town now. We ate once in the hotel restaurant - very good - but then avoided the expensive breakfast and New Year parties and went across the street to Mohrings for almost all other meals. Don't miss the chocolate store on the corner and music concerts in the Hall in front of the hotel. The subway stop StadtMitte is in front of the hotel.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location: Great location. Located opposite German Cathedral and it's near Brandenburg Gate, Pergammon Museum
reviews.title: happy at the hilton

likes.disliked: — daily limited cofee/ tea making items,charging system for minibar

reviews.text: On a trip through Europe my friend and I stayed at the Hilton as a part of a package deal. It was nice but for what you pay I would say there would be better. All the things that were good about it were what I would've expected from a hotel with 5 stars, just not sure it's worth it. If you're happy to pay then stay here as it's lovely and they look after you well. I'm just not sure it's worth the extra money just for a bed for the night. Wifi was a little expensive too.
reviews.title: What you would expect from a 5 star hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful hotel in a wonderful city. Smack in the middle of the city. Staff helpful and courteous. Restaurant and executive lounge were of high standard. Stayed for four nights but needed more. Will definitely go back.
reviews.title: Hilton Berlin

reviews.text: Fantastic location. Modern amenities.
reviews.title: mediocre service

reviews.text: Mediocre service, at best:
reviews.title: well done

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -didn't do a wake-up call
reviews.title: very nice hotel in a great place

reviews.text: we recently took a city break in Berlin with a couple of friends and stayed at the Hilton. What a great choice it turned out to be. We booked executive rooms which were excellent. Tanya at check in couldn't have been more helpful.The lounge itself was the perfect spot for some r and r after a long day siteseeing. It looks out over the pictureque Gendarmenmarkt with its beautiful cathedrals. Breakfast in the lounge is continental style however the buffet style breakfast in the main dining area was fantastic. We also had dinner in the Brandenberg restaurant attached the hotel which was superb. The waiting staff were attentive and the food was delightful. Full marks for service.
reviews.title: brilliant berlin

likes.liked: — location location location and the service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in our opinion ideally located for exploring the city and the Stadmitte U Bahn station is literally at the front door.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would also recommend the Berlin walking tour which commences from Starbucks beside the Brandenberg Gate at 1.15pm each afternoon and the Refugium restaurant beside the french Cathedral on Gendarmenmarkt. Superb food and excellent service.
reviews.title: Comfortable, good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Try hiring a bike for the day and tour the sites, Tiergarten is a must. The concierge arranged them for us and in a matter of minutes they were at the front door and only 15 euro for the day.
reviews.title: A city hotel to enjoy

likes.liked: — Having separate sitting room to bedroom
likes.disliked: — Bathroom a little on the small side for thsi quality of hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is centrally located - walking distance to shops, sites and train station.
reviews.title: Great location - good service

reviews.text: Friendly service on checking in at Reception. Their bar area was undergoing renovations (July 2010), but there were plenty of other places to visit.
reviews.title: Up to the Hilton standards

reviews.text: The room was fine – had enough pillows – nice doona – good big bed! Comfortable all round - the decor was a bit dated, although it did have a good sized TV monitor. The Internet price at the Business Centre was 0.35¢ € per minute.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, superb location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If I had to mention a negative aspect, I guess it would be the distance we had to walk from our room which was on one corner of the hotel to the opposite side of the complex to visit the Executive Lounge which was no big deal (good exercise - LOL!).
reviews.title: Excellent levels of service, well recommended

reviews.text: The amenities in their Executive Lounge were good and it was open for most of the day. Their Afternoon Tea was lovely as were the beers and cold Cokes. They also had 2 Internet terminals which were free-of-charge but they suggested only 15mins usage (to allow others to also use them).
reviews.title: The East is Best

reviews.text: This was our third stay at the Hilton Berlin and it's really was the best so far. The recent renovation has improved the hotel rooms, lobby and executive lounge, making the hotel more modern. The location is perfect for exploring the city: subway in front of the hotel; dining facilities, shops and tourist attractions on walking distance.
reviews.title: Couldn't be better

reviews.text: We stayed here in Sept. 2011, and enjoyed our stay, it is very well located, just 2 short blocks from the main commercial walking/shopping street and less than 10 minutes walk to where "check point charlie" is located, and across the street from a beautiful plaza. The hotel appears to be more of a business hotel, but travelers will be very comfortable here, as the rooms are decent sized & well appointed. Didn't try any of the hotel restaurants/bars as we like to walk out & enjoy what the city has to offer. Many restaurants & cafes, bakeries nearby, so no shortage of food around.
reviews.title: Great location, nice rooms

reviews.text: I stayed there a few years ago and I remember that I wasn't too happy about the rooms, but now they have renovated them so it has the standard that one would expect.
reviews.title: Very nicely renovated

reviews.text: The food was very good and service impacable. Location is also excellent, only some 5-10min walk from Brandeburg Tor.
reviews.title: Great location for work and pleasure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only thing I really need to complain about is the rediculous extra charge of some 15 Eur in order to use the sauna. You would really expect a 5 star hotel to include it in the premium price it already charges for the stay.
reviews.title: Guaranteed Hilton with stars - no surprises

reviews.text: Excellent hotel, perfectly placed to see all the sights of Berlin only a short walk away from Unter den Linden, Brandenburg gate etc. Nice quiet part of the city too.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Hilton for a long weekend break. We chose it because of the Hilton brand and also the central location of the hotel.
reviews.title: Nice modern hotel let down by poor service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is nice and modern. It has all the facilities you would expect from a large hotel chain like the Hilton. Rooms are of a good size and bathrooms are well-equipped (Crabtree & Evelyn toiletries). Our room had a view of the Gendarmenmarkt.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Recommended

likes.liked: — The aircon - it was very hot in Berlin, generally just a great hotel
likes.disliked: — Size of room - a bigger one and maybe a better view would have been good but all in all still agood experience

reviews.text: It is located in a somewhat quiet part of town and apart from Checkpoint Charlie, you have to take a U-Bahn or bus to get anywhere (unless you're a keen walker). The U-Bahn station is right outside the hotel though, so not a problem.
reviews.title: it's where that matters

reviews.text: Service however was poor. We arrived at 12pm and were told that our Executive Room wouldn't be ready till 1. That was fine, as their earliest stated check-in time is 2, so we were invited to chill in the Executive Lounge and they offered to look after our luggage until then.
reviews.title: below average Hilton
Beware Hotel's Charges
reviews.text: Hotel is well-situated near main attractions, restaurants and shopping. Room was clean, well furnished and serviced promptly. The room air conditioning had a hard time keeping up with the warm temperatures in Berlin. The restaurant (Mark Brandenburg) was over-priced and had marginal food. The hotel was overrun with meetings and groups.

reviews.title: Fantastic!
reviews.text: There was an unexplained, additional Hotel charge of 8 Euros that appeared on my credit card statement. I challenged the charge in an e-mail to the hotel, and followed up with e-mails to the Hotel (twice), HiltonHonors and Hilton corporate. None of these Hilton entities have had the courtesy of even responding (no less reversing this charge) in over a week.

reviews.title: I gotta get back there!
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Hilton Hotel - Berlin for 3 nights during the last week in May. This hotel is a great place to stay!

reviews.title: Perfect!
reviews.text: The room was extremely neat , clean, and nicely decorated. It had TV and a nice king bed. The bathroom had a shower in the tub. No complaints about the room.

reviews.title: Quality in a convenient location.
reviews.text: The hotel staff was very courteous and helpful. Other reviews allude to not-so-good experiences with the concierge, but to us he was extremely helpful. Everyone spoke execellent English and no-one seemed to mind my less-than-perfect German.
